title: Get started
text: Start exploring indicators available: Get time series data indicators need: Use convenience functions common filtering operations:
code: library(cnbrrr)  # Get all available indicators indicators <- arad_get_indicators() head(indicators)  # Search for specific indicators gdp_indicators <- arad_get_indicators(search = "GDP") monetary_indicators <- arad_get_indicators(search = "monetary")  # Filter by category fiscal_indicators <- arad_get_indicators(category = "fiscal") # Get data for a single indicator data <- arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C") head(data)  # Get data for multiple indicators at once multi_data <- arad_get_data(c("SRUMD08402C", "SRUMD08401C"))  # Get raw data without processing (returns raw CSV data) raw_data <- arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C", process_data = FALSE) # Get December data for all available years dec_data <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C", filter_month = 12)  # Get data for a specific year data_2023 <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C", filter_year = 2023)  # Get data with both filters and rename the value column spending <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C",                             filter_month = 12,                            filter_year = 2023,                            rename_value = "government_spending")

title: Get started
text: ’s full workflow analyzing Czech economic data:
code: library(cnbrrr) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  # 1. Find relevant indicators indicators <- arad_get_indicators(search = "GDP") print(head(indicators))  # 2. Get the data (assuming we found a GDP indicator) gdp_data <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C",                             filter_month = 12,  # December data only                            rename_value = "gdp")  # 3. Process and analyze recent_gdp <- gdp_data %>%   filter(year >= 2010) %>%   arrange(year) %>%   mutate(     gdp_growth = (gdp / lag(gdp) - 1) * 100,     is_recession = gdp_growth < 0   )  # 4. Summary statistics gdp_summary <- recent_gdp %>%   summarise(     mean_gdp = mean(gdp, na.rm = TRUE),     mean_growth = mean(gdp_growth, na.rm = TRUE),     latest_year = max(year, na.rm = TRUE),     latest_gdp = gdp[year == latest_year][1],     recession_years = sum(is_recession, na.rm = TRUE)   )  print(gdp_summary)  # 5. Create visualization gdp_plot <- ggplot(recent_gdp, aes(x = year, y = gdp)) +   geom_line(color = "#0000ff", size = 1.2) +   geom_point(color = "#0000ff", size = 2) +   geom_point(data = filter(recent_gdp, is_recession),               color = "red", size = 3, alpha = 0.7) +   labs(     title = "Czech GDP Trend",     subtitle = "Annual data from Czech National Bank ARAD. Red points indicate recession years.",     x = "Year",     y = "GDP Value",     caption = "Source: Czech National Bank ARAD API via cnbrrr package"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold", color = "#001F3F"),     plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12, color = "gray60"),     text = element_text(color = "#001F3F")   )  print(gdp_plot)  # 6. Growth rate visualization growth_plot <- ggplot(recent_gdp, aes(x = year, y = gdp_growth)) +   geom_col(aes(fill = is_recession), alpha = 0.8) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray50") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("FALSE" = "#0000ff", "TRUE" = "red")) +   labs(     title = "Czech GDP Growth Rate",     subtitle = "Year-over-year percentage change",     x = "Year",     y = "GDP Growth (%)",     fill = "Recession",     caption = "Source: Czech National Bank ARAD API via cnbrrr package"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold", color = "#001F3F"),     plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12, color = "gray60"),     text = element_text(color = "#001F3F"),     legend.position = "bottom"   )  print(growth_plot)

title: Get started
text: package includes comprehensive error handling common issues:
code: # Invalid API key try({   arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C", api_key = "invalid_key") })  # Invalid indicator ID try({   arad_get_metadata("TOTALLY_INVALID_ID") })  # Empty indicator list try({   arad_get_data(character(0)) })  # Network/API errors are caught and reported clearly try({   arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C", base_url = "https://invalid.url/api") })
